###EXAMPLE OF NON-LINEAR CLASSIFICATION:
<br>

From [Andrew Ng ML course](https://youtu.be/1PZdrgWak8Y):

<br>

<img src="https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/9312897/18116270/5732e4e4-6f14-11e6-99de-63533f002a9c.png" width="500">

Simplifying the classification problem on the right as a binary $0/1$ $x_1$ and $x_2$ prediction we have the equivalent of an XOR gate:

<br>

<img src="https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/9312897/18128457/d05cede4-6f53-11e6-947b-f8e1dcf9d459.jpg" width="500">

In fact, if the circles are zeros, the model is more of an XNOR function: $y = x_1 \text{XNOR} x_2 = \text{NOT} (x_1 \text{XOR} x_2)$.
